Fresh lime juice, red onion, chiles, and cilantro give it amazing flavor. It’s best served with spoons for scooping into your palm.Ingredients4 servings½small red onion, finely chopped2serrano chiles, seeds removed, finely choppedZest and juice of ½ limeKosher salt1¼cups salted, dry-roasted skin-on Spanish peanuts½cup finely chopped cilantro¼tsp. chili powderPreparationStep 1Combine onion, chiles, lime zest and lime juice, and a large pinch of salt in a medium bowl. Let sit a minute or so to allow flavors to come together and for onion to mellow.Step 2Add peanuts, cilantro, and chili powder to onion mixture and give it all a good toss. Taste and season with more salt as needed.Step 3Serve peanut mixture in a small bowl with spoons.How would you rate Peanut Drinking Snack?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (2)Back to TopTriangleThis is hands down my favorite snack to have with drinks, which I first ate in India. Thanks to bon appetit for printing the recipe here. It is delicious and pretty much the best way to eat peanuts!KatjaNew York1/22/2021This was exactly what I was looking for.
